title: How do the enzymes catalyze the reactions under mild conditions? - Quora

response.answer_text: Essentially, two molecules to be joined by an enzyme attach to the enzyme in close proximity. The attachment tugs on the electrons of the two molecules so that the probability increases that the electrons of the two molecules will assume a configuration so the molecules spontaneously form a bond between them. The same idea applies in for the breaking of bonds in a molecule during enzymatic cleavage. See Enzyme catalysis - Wikipedia

Tony Russel found a great link, so I am including it here. He wrote about proximity, which is one of many mechanisms for catalysis discussed in the article. One of the main ones is differential binding of substrate and transition state. Enzyme catalysis - Wikipedia
